Create Matplotlib Collections¶

Matplotlib collections can be created from pandapower networks with the following functions:

Busses¶

plotting.create_bus_collection(net, busses, size=5, marker='o', patch_type='circle', colors=None, infofunc=None, cmap=None, picker=False, **kwargs)¶

Creates a matplotlib patch collection

Busses are the nodal points of the network that all other elements connect to.

Input:

net (PandapowerNet) - The pandapower network

busses (list) - The busses for which the collections are created

Optional:

size (int, 5) - patch size

marker (str, “o”) - patch

patch_type (str, “circle”) - patch

colors* (list, None) -

Lines¶

plotting.create_line_collection(net, lines, use_line_geodata=True, infofunc=None, **kwargs)¶
plotting.create_direct_line_collection(net, lines=None, gis_components=None, linewidth=1.0, alpha=0.75, zorder=1, color=(0.4, 0.4, 0.4), linestyles='solid')¶

Sectioning Points¶

plotting.create_trennstellen_collection(net, switches=None, scale=10, **kwargs)¶

Transformers¶

plotting.create_trafo_collection(net, tid, **kwargs)¶

Returns a Collection of lines from the lv-bus to the hv-bus. Note: its recommended to make them somewhat thicker using linewidths, in order to make them visible
